silhouette.options.enabled.name: show silhouettes
silhouette.options.enabled.tooltip: turn the mod on or off
silhouette.options.visual_style.name: outline style
silhouette.options.visual_style.tooltip: minecraft style looks like minecraft's default glowing effect. apex style looks like apex legends. try both and see which one you prefer
silhouette.options.gamertags.name: show gamertags
silhouette.options.gamertags.tooltip: show gamertags clearly through walls and beyond the normal range
silhouette.options.should_render_within_: should only render within distance tooltip
silhouette.options.should_outline_only_w: only display outline when player is completely hidden behind cover. this operation is somewhat expensive and might impact your fps!
silhouette.options.sodium_compat.name: silhouette
silhouette.options.view_distance.tooltip: The render distance controls how far away terrain will be rendered. Lower distances mean that less terrain will be rendered, improving frame rates.
silhouette.options.brightness.tooltip: Controls the brightness (gamma) of the game.
silhouette.options.gui_scale.tooltip: Sets the maximum scale factor to be used for the user interface. If 'auto' is used, then the largest scale factor will always be used.
silhouette.options.fullscreen.tooltip: If enabled, the game will display in full-screen (if supported).
silhouette.options.v_sync.tooltip: If enabled, the game's frame rate will be synchronized to the monitor's refresh rate, making for a generally smoother experience at the expense of overall input latency. This setting might reduce performance if your system is too slow.
silhouette.options.fps_limit.tooltip: Limits the maximum number of frames per second. This can help reduce battery usage and general system load when multi-tasking. If V-Sync is enabled, this option will be ignored unless it is lower than your display's refresh rate.
silhouette.options.view_bobbing.tooltip: If enabled, the player's view will sway and bob when moving around. Players who experience motion sickness while playing can benefit from disabling this.
silhouette.options.attack_indicator.tool: Controls where the Attack Indicator is displayed on screen.
silhouette.options.graphics_quality.tool: The default graphics quality controls some legacy options and is necessary for mod compatibility. If the options below are left to "Default", they will use this setting.
silhouette.options.clouds_quality.toolti: Controls the quality of rendered clouds in the sky.
silhouette.options.weather_quality.toolt: Controls the quality of rain and snow effects.
silhouette.options.leaves_quality.name: Leaves Quality
silhouette.options.particle_quality.name: Particle Quality
silhouette.options.particle_quality.tool: Controls the maximum number of particles which can be present on screen at any one time.
silhouette.options.smooth_lighting.toolt: Controls whether blocks will be smoothly lit and shaded. This slightly increases the amount of time needed to re-build a chunk, but doesn't affect frame rates.
silhouette.options.biome_blend.tooltip: Controls the range which biomes will be sampled for block colorization. Higher values greatly increase the amount of time it takes to build chunks for diminishing improvements in quality.
silhouette.options.entity_distance.toolt: Controls how far away entities can render from the player. Higher values increase the render distance at the expense of frame rates.
silhouette.options.entity_shadows.toolti: If enabled, basic shadows will be rendered beneath mobs and other entities.
silhouette.options.vignette.name: Vignette
silhouette.options.vignette.tooltip: If enabled, a vignette effect will be rendered on the player's view. This is very unlikely to make a difference to frame rates unless you are fill-rate limited.
silhouette.options.mipmap_levels.tooltip: Controls the number of mipmaps which will be used for block model textures. Higher values provide better rendering of blocks in the distance, but may adversely affect performance with many animated textures.
silhouette.options.use_block_face_cullin: If enabled, only the sides of blocks which are facing the camera will be submitted for rendering. This can eliminate a large number of block faces very early in the rendering process, saving memory bandwidth and time on the GPU. Some resource packs may have issues with this option, so try disabling it if you're seeing holes in blocks.
silhouette.options.use_fog_occlusion.too: If enabled, chunks which are determined to be fully hidden by fog effects will not be rendered, helping to improve performance. The improvement can be more dramatic when fog effects are heavier (such as while underwater), but it may cause undesirable visual artifacts between the sky and fog in some scenarios.
silhouette.options.use_entity_culling.to: If enabled, entities determined not to be in any visible chunks will be skipped during rendering. This can help improve performance by avoiding the rendering of entities located underground or behind walls.
If enabled, only particles which are determined to be visible will be rendered. This can provide a significant improvement to frame rates when many particles are nearby.
silhouette.options.animate_only_visible_: If enabled, only animated textures determined to be visible will be updated. This can provide a significant boost to frame rates on some hardware, especially with heavier resource packs. If you experience issues with some textures not being animated, try disabling this option.
silhouette.options.max_pre_rendered_fram: Specifies the maximum number of frames the CPU can be waiting on the GPU to finish rendering. Very low or high values may create frame rate instability.
silhouette.options.allow_direct_memory_a: If enabled, some critical code paths will be allowed to use direct memory access for performance. This often greatly reduces CPU overhead for chunk and entity rendering, but can make it harder to diagnose some bugs and crashes. You should only disable this if you've been asked to or otherwise know what you're doing.
silhouette.options.enable_memory_tracing: Debugging feature. If enabled, stack traces will be collected alongside memory allocations to help improve diagnostic information when memory leaks are detected.
silhouette.options.use_persistent_mappin:
If enabled, a small amount of memory will be persistently mapped as a staging buffer for chunk uploading, helping to reduce CPU overhead and frame time instability when loading or updating chunks.

Requires OpenGL 4.4 or ARB_buffer_storage.
silhouette.options.chunk_memory_allocato:
Selects the memory allocator that will be used for chunk rendering.
- ASYNC: Fastest option, works well with most modern graphics drivers.
- SWAP: Fallback option for older graphics drivers. May increase memory usage significantly.
